title: Shahid Kapoor: Vishal Bhardwaj's films precious jewels for me
text:
With 'Kaminey' and 'Haider', Vishal Bhardwaj has given Shahid Kapoor breakthrough roles in his career and the actor is on cloud nine for getting a chance to work with the director for the third time in 'Rangoon'.

Shahid Kapoor 
The upcoming period drama also stars Saif Ali Khan and Kangana Ranaut in lead roles.
The 34-year-old actor heaped praise on his co-stars, calling them "phenomenally talented".
"I am very excited to be starring in 'Rangoon'. Any film with Vishal Bhardwaj is like a precious jewel for me. So, I hope I can give him the character that he needs me to play.
That's what I need to do and I am focusing on that," Shahid told reporters here.
"Saif and Kangana are phenomenally talented. Kangana has had an outstanding last couple of years and she is taking acting to another level and changing the benchmark for all of us. Saif is somebody, who did his best work (Omkara) with Vishal sir. He has got an amazing character in 'Rangoon'," he added.
There is a lot of buzz around the casting of the film as it brings together for the first time Shahid and Saif, who have a personal history with the latter married to the "R...Rajkumar" actor's former girlfriend Kareena Kapoor.
Shahid, however, seems to be unaffected by the speculation and only wants to concentrate on his performance.
"To me, it is a coming together of two actors due to a vision of a director, I have amazing respect for. I also have huge respect for the two actors I am going to work with in the film.
"So, I am really excited to enter that space and doing this movie and hoping that I am able to do what my director wants from me. That's how I look at it," he said.
Shahid will be next seen in "Shaandaar", co-starring Alia Bhatt, his father Pankaj Kapur and sister Sanah in her Bollywood debut.
The film, directed by Vikas Bahl, releases on October 22.
